meanings.definition: A black nursemaid or nanny in the southern US
meanings.sent1: The mammy cared for the children with kindness.
meanings.sent2: The mammy sang lullabies to the baby.
meanings.sent3: The children loved playing with their mammy in the yard.
meanings.sent4: She was like a guardian angel, a mammy watching over them.
meanings.sent5: The image of the mammy holding the baby was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: Mother or mom, especially in a dialect or informal context.
meanings.sent1: My mammy makes the best pancakes on Sundays.
meanings.sent2: I asked my mammy for advice on what to wear.
meanings.sent3: When I pretended to be sick, my mammy saw right through me.
meanings.sent4: Her love enveloped me like a warm hug from my mammy.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cookies baking always reminds me of my mammy.
